mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, George Washington to Col. [George] Gilpin, 1785 October 29
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, George, 1732-1799
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Washington first asks Gilpin for the use of a scow with which he intends to dredge mud from the river bottom for trial as fertilizer. Then he goes into some detail about the making of a water level and staff which he desires, "I have joiners that could execute the wooden work ... but my Smith is too great a bungler to entrust anything to him, ..." Washington asks Gilpin to have the iron work done for him, or, if he thinks it preferable to make the complete instrument for him. Autograph letter signed, one page.
